   - Where bugs are fixed, where possible, there should be unit tests
     demonstrating the bug and also proving the fix. This helps prevent regression.

+[conventions](devel/developer-notes.md#internal-interface-guidelines), like passing

commit.message: doc: Use internal links where possible

verification.payload:
tree 7234679a8af3599f7a393136b74d6440057426ee
parent fa886aef5965b2d23057ab18b121a9357c2994c8
author MarcoFalke <falke.marco@gmail.com> 1637086558 +0100
committer MarcoFalke <falke.marco@gmail.com> 1637134508 +0100

doc: Use internal links where possible

files.patch:
@@ -25,7 +25,7 @@ There is also a runner script to execute all fuzz targets. Refer to
 
 ## Fuzzing harnesses and output
 
-[`process_message`](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/src/test/fuzz/process_message.cpp) is a fuzzing harness for the [`ProcessMessage(...)` function (`net_processing`)](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/src/net_processing.cpp). The available fuzzing harnesses are found in [`src/test/fuzz/`](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/tree/master/src/test/fuzz).
+[`process_message`](/src/test/fuzz/process_message.cpp) is a fuzzing harness for the [`ProcessMessage(...)` function (`net_processing`)](/src/net_processing.cpp). The available fuzzing harnesses are found in [`src/test/fuzz/`](/src/test/fuzz).
 
 The fuzzer will output `NEW` every time it has created a test input that covers new areas of the code under test. For more information on how to interpret the fuzzer output, see the [libFuzzer documentation](https://llvm.org/docs/LibFuzzer.html).

verification.payload:
tree af48182c789bf1b27e2d50f8cde9377df08bb93d
parent 555599a861519a7db52f43d2c4aa08ce8dde6258

doc: Move doxygen to doc/developer

files.patch:
@@ -345,7 +345,7 @@ CLEANFILES = $(OSX_DMG) $(BITCOIN_WIN_INSTALLER)
 
 DISTCHECK_CONFIGURE_FLAGS = --enable-man
 
-doc/doxygen/.stamp: doc/Doxyfile FORCE
+doc/doxygen/.stamp: doc/developer/Doxyfile FORCE
 	$(MKDIR_P) $(@D)
 	$(DOXYGEN) $^
 	$(AM_V_at) touch $@

@@ -28,7 +28,7 @@
 
 # Docs
 /doc/*[a-zA-Z-].md                          @harding
-/doc/Doxyfile.in                            @fanquake
+/doc/developer/Doxyfile.in                  @fanquake
 /doc/REST-interface.md                      @jonasschnelli
 /doc/developer/benchmarking.md              @ariard
 /doc/bitcoin-conf.md                        @hebasto

@@ -1860,7 +1860,7 @@ AC_SUBST(HAVE_STRONG_GETAUXVAL)
 AC_SUBST(ANDROID_ARCH)
 AC_CONFIG_FILES([Makefile src/Makefile doc/man/Makefile share/setup.nsi share/qt/Info.plist test/config.ini])
 AC_CONFIG_FILES([contrib/devtools/split-debug.sh],[chmod +x contrib/devtools/split-debug.sh])
-AM_COND_IF([HAVE_DOXYGEN], [AC_CONFIG_FILES([doc/Doxyfile])])
+AM_COND_IF([HAVE_DOXYGEN], [AC_CONFIG_FILES([doc/developer/Doxyfile])])
 AC_CONFIG_LINKS([contrib/devtools/security-check.py:contrib/devtools/security-check.py])
 AC_CONFIG_LINKS([contrib/devtools/symbol-check.py:contrib/devtools/symbol-check.py])
 AC_CONFIG_LINKS([contrib/devtools/test-security-check.py:contrib/devtools/test-security-check.py])

@@ -51,7 +51,7 @@ PROJECT_BRIEF          = "P2P Digital Currency"
 # pixels and the maximum width should not exceed 200 pixels. Doxygen will copy
 # the logo to the output directory.
 
-PROJECT_LOGO           = doc/bitcoin_logo_doxygen.png
+PROJECT_LOGO           = doc/developer/bitcoin_logo_doxygen.png
 
 # The OUTPUT_DIRECTORY tag is used to specify the (relative or absolute) path
 # into which the generated documentation will be written. If a relative path is
@@ -790,7 +790,7 @@ WARN_LOGFILE           =
 # spaces. See also FILE_PATTERNS and EXTENSION_MAPPING
 # Note: If this tag is empty the current directory is searched.
 
-INPUT                  = src doc/README_doxygen.md
+INPUT                  = src doc/developer/README_doxygen.md
 
 # This tag can be used to specify the character encoding of the source files
 # that doxygen parses. Internally doxygen uses the UTF-8 encoding. Doxygen uses
@@ -973,7 +973,7 @@ FILTER_SOURCE_PATTERNS =
 # (index.html). This can be useful if you have a project on for instance GitHub
 # and want to reuse the introduction page also for the doxygen output.
 
-USE_MDFILE_AS_MAINPAGE = doc/README_doxygen.md
+USE_MDFILE_AS_MAINPAGE = doc/developer/README_doxygen.md
 
 #---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 # Configuration options related to source browsing

@@ -231,7 +231,7 @@ Recommendations:
 - Avoid linking to external documentation; links can break.
 
 - Javadoc and all valid Doxygen comments are stripped from Doxygen source code
-  previews (`STRIP_CODE_COMMENTS = YES` in [Doxyfile.in](doc/Doxyfile.in)). If
+  previews (`STRIP_CODE_COMMENTS = YES` in [Doxyfile.in](doc/developer/Doxyfile.in)). If
   you want a comment to be preserved, it must instead use `//` or `/* */`.
 
 ### Generating Documentation
